profileAlternative.name: Tara Kizer
profileAlternative.headline: Senior Consultant at Straight Path IT Solutions
profileAlternative.summary:
19 years of experience as a Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator

Specialties: Performance tuning, high availability, disaster recovery, Always On Availability Groups, cluster administration, database design, custom database maintenance scripts, data import and export, data recovery, Transactional Replication and troubleshooting complex database problems

I am passionate about SQL Server. I help answer questions on SQLTeam.com and dba.stackexchange.com, have presented at three SQL Saturday conferences and am co-author of a SQL Server book entitled TribalSQL. My chapter is "Performance Tuning with SQL Trace and Extended Events". I was a Microsoft MVP for SQL Server from July 2007 to July 2017.

aboutAlternative.text:
19 years of experience as a Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator

Specialties: Performance tuning, high availability, disaster recovery, Always On Availability Groups, cluster administration, database design, custom database maintenance scripts, data import and export, data recovery, Transactional Replication and troubleshooting complex database problems

I am passionate about SQL Server. positions.title: SQL Server MVP
positions.description: It was a good 10-year run as an MVP.

positions.title: Senior Database Administrator
positions.description:
Production DBA

Main responsibilities:
- Performance Tuning
- Index analysis
- Analysis of query plans
- Code Refactoring
- Wait Stats analysis
- Performance Monitor
- SQL Sentry
- DR failovers using Availability Groups and Database Mirroring
- 24x7 on-call support in 4-person rotation
- SQL Server installations
- Windows and SQL patching
- Transactional Replication support
- Primary DBA support for Warehouse Management Systems databases
- Supporting application releases
- Scrum team member
- SSIS package support for DBA-type packages
- Troubleshooting job failures
- Adding features such as collecting Database Mail and Job History from 50 servers
- Upgrade databases to SQL Server 2012

Environments:
- SQL Server 2012 and 2008 R2
- Windows 2012 and 2008 R2 (clusters and standalones)
- Availability Groups
- Database Mirroring
- Transactional Replication
- SSIS 2012 and 2008 R2
- Physical and virtual servers
…
see more

positions.title: Sr Staff Database Administrator
positions.description:
Qualcomm sold the Omnitracs division in November 2013. This is continued employment from the below position at Qualcomm.

Designed and support a 6-node highly available, mission critical cluster utilizing AlwaysOn Availability Groups which provided failover, reporting and disaster recovery capabilities. Upgrading to this environment dramatically increased database performance and eliminated latency for the reporting environment. This cluster spans two geographically dispersed data centers and is using the multi-subnet feature.

Lead Database Administrator for SQL Server 2012, 2008 R2, 2008, 2005.

Provide 24/7 support for production database servers and critical non-production database servers.

In-depth performance analysis using service-side traces, extended events, SQL Profiler, ClearTrace, Performance Monitor, Quest’s Performance Analysis (Foglight) and Spotlight tools, SQL Sentry and DMV queries.

Work with development teams to design new databases and refactor existing databases.

Refresh non-production environments using production backups, both manually and automatically on a schedule.

Rewrote stored procedures according to best practices but also to improve performance.

Upgraded databases to SQL Server 2012 utilizing database mirroring to minimize downtime.
…
see more

positions.title: Sr Staff Database Administrator
positions.description:
Performed database administration on SQL Server 2012, 2008 R2, 2008 and 2005, including high availability and disaster recovery support.

Technical lead in the 9-person SQL Server database team.

24/7 support for production, including numerous mission critical databases such as one used for heart monitors.

Provided detailed performance analysis using various tools, such as SQL Profiler, SQL Trace, Performance Monitor, and the Performance Dashboard reports.

Wrote custom database maintenance routines for backups, integrity checks, refreshing databases, and defragmenting indexes.

Worked directly with developers to design the databases. Rewrote inefficient SQL code to increase query response times.

Used Quest's Litespeed and Red Gate's SQL Backup Pro tools for SQL backups. Included these tools as options in the backup stored procedure.

Wrote SQL Trace program which runs a constant server-side trace, collects the raw trace data, and then aggregates the data for later analysis.
…
see more

positions.title: Intermediate Database Administrator
positions.description:
Assigned to the County of San Diego contract.

Responsible for database administration for eighteen production databases (five of which are mission critical) and six test databases, using Microsoft SQL Server 6.5, 7.0, 2000 and Centura SQLBase 7.5.1.

Monitored and tuned the databases using SQL Profiler and Performance Monitor.

Advised developers about table, index, and view design.

Ensured data availability, accuracy, completeness, integrity, and consistency via SQL jobs.

Upgraded several databases from SQL Server 6.5 to SQL Server 7.0 and also from SQL Server 7.0 to SQL Server 2000.

Assisted production support personnel with client connectivity problems to the databases.

Designed production transfer jobs, which included the use of DTS, bcp, and osql.
…
see more

positions.title: County of San Diego
positions.description:
Junior Database Administrator in the Department of Information Services which supported the IT functions of most departments in County of San Diego.

Responsible for Microsoft SQL Server 6.5 and 7.0 database maintenance including monitoring of server activity, system administration, table creations, deletions, or changes utilizing ERwin/ERX or Transact-SQL.

Installed Windows NT server and desktop, Microsoft SQL Server utilities and server edition, client/server applications, Visual Studio, ODBC drivers, and Sybase SQL Server utilities.

Performed data transfers through the MDI database gateway (MDI is a Sybase Company) server using TSO and Infohub (Trinzic Corporation software package) on the mainframe. Transfers are written in Transact-SQL and occur manually through the Command Prompt or are automated through Microsoft SQL Server 7.0. Created document detailing all transfers using the MDI database gateway.
…
see more

Title
Student Worker
positions.description:
Designed, coded, and implemented an inventory program in SQLWindows 5.0.3 tracking technical books and software packages.

Performed personal computer problem resolution including operating system and printer problems, 16-bit and 32-bit ODBC driver conflicts, network connectivity using TCP/IP, Named Pipes, and NWLink IPX/SPX, database errors, and network drive mappings.

Developed written job procedures for clerical staff to establish standard training practices.

Installed personal computers and provided technical support to fellow employees.

Performed data entry, filing, and pickup and deliveries between the courthouses and other county offices.

educations.title: San Diego State University
educations.degree: B.S. in Mathematics with emphasis in Computer Science

given.text:
Tara is the largest contributor on the SQLTeam.com forums. She has helped tens of thousands of people with their SQL Server problems. She publicly demonstrates her expertise in solving enterprise-class problems ranging from disaster recovery to high availability to performance tuning. I’m confident that when people ask the most difficult SQL Server questions Tara will be able to answer them. She’s shown tremendous patience in helping people using a sometimes difficult medium. She regularly posts maintenance scripts on her blog that are used by thousands of people. I know when I ask a question Tara is one of the people I hope to see a response from.
…
See more

I have worked with Tara for many years. Tara was part of our development team, and provided production support for our products, based on Microsoft technologies. We always felt the database was in good hands with Tara. She did a great job of finding performance issues, and rewriting queries here and there for better performance. Tara would be a contributing member of the design meetings, guiding schema designs and data relationships. Tara has a great deal of knowledge of SQL Server (all versions), and I noticed that she was constantly learning more. She was always willing to lend a hand when issues crop up. And of course she did a great job of doing all the things DBAs do that allow developers not to have to think about the issues involved with keeping a database up, running, performing and highly available. I know that on projects that I was not involved in, Tara was the sole owner of the database, from schema design, to all the stored procedures and queries that the application called, to maintenance and production support of the database. I would not hesitate to recommend Tara as a DBA.
…
See more

Tara is an extremely knowledgeable and hard working database administrator, with a vast amount of technical experience with Microsoft SQL Server systems. She can not only effectively and efficiently solve a wide variety of issues, but also provide valuable insight in regards to performance, design considerations and industry standards in the database arena. She is constantly improving her expertise in database administration as demonstrated by her key participation at SQLTeam.com and appointment by Microsoft as a SQL Server MVP.
…
See more

received.text:
As owner and poster of SQLTeam.com, Bill has helped thousands, perhaps millions, of people with their SQL Server issues.  His site is one of the leading places to go for SQL Server information.

Bill has developed SQL Server tools and posted them to his blog, which have helped me do my job better as a Database Administrator.  

Bill's blog is educational and informative.  I make sure to read all of his articles as I know there is always something to learn from him.

peopleAlsoViewed.text: SQL Server DBA at Tax Compliance, Inc.
Senior Consultant at Straight Path IT Solutions, LLC
Sr. Database Architect at Black Mountain Systems
